text: Vice Admiral Andries Petrus Putter SSAS SD MMM (2 December 1935 - 17 July 2014) was a South African military commander. He served as Chief of the South African Navy twice, first from 1982 to 1985 and again from 1989 to 1990.Fact file: Chiefs of the South African Navy | DefenceWebSADF.info He was born in Brits in 1935. He joined the Navy in 1960 after a career in the Merchant Navy. In 1969 he commanded the SAS Port Elizabeth and became Senior Officer of the Minesweeper Flotilla. In 1982 he was appointed Chief of Naval Staff and in 1985 as the Chief of the Navy. He later served as Chief of Defence Intelligence. Putter died in Johannesburg, South Africa from kidney failure, aged 78. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Afrikaner people Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:Disease-related deaths in South Africa Category:South African military people Category:White South African people
